meanings.sent1: The alley behind the restaurant was much grungier than the front street.
meanings.sent2: After playing in the mud, her clothes looked grungier than ever before.
meanings.sent3: The grungier the old car looked, the more it seemed to attract curious stares.
meanings.sent4: The grungier the kitchen floor, the more determined she was to clean it thoroughly.
meanings.sent5: The grungier the water in the pond, the more frogs seemed to gather around it.

meanings.definition: Worn-out or shabby in style or condition
meanings.sent1: The grungier couch in the living room was still the most comfortable.
meanings.sent2: As the years passed, his favorite hat became grungier and grungier.
meanings.sent3: The grungier the old teddy bear looked, the more sentimental value it seemed to hold.
meanings.sent4: Her grungier sneakers were perfect for the muddy trail ahead.
meanings.sent5: The grungier the book cover, the more intriguing the story inside.
